title: F-Strings: Formatted String Literals
shortDescription: F-strings provide the fastest and most readable way to format strings in Python!
detailedDescription: Introduced in Python 3.6, f-strings (formatted string literals) are the most efficient and readable way to format strings. They allow embedding expressions directly inside string literals and are faster than both .format() and % formatting. F-strings can include complex expressions, function calls, and formatting specifications.
examples: print(f'The sum of {x} and {y} is {x + y}')
